This is module for database access

TelegramBot.db.add_purchase(params)[source]¶
TelegramBot.db.check_family_login(login)[source]¶

Check for existing family account :param login: special name of family for authifications :return: -1 if family not found, 0 family founded

TelegramBot.db.connect_db()[source]¶

Function for connection to our database :return: database connection

TelegramBot.db.execute_read_query(connection, query)[source]¶

Executes queries to find data in the database :param connection: connection with db :param query: database query :return: result of query

TelegramBot.db.get_family_id(user_id)[source]¶
TelegramBot.db.get_period_members(period_name, period, family_id)[source]¶

Searches information about family members who made purchases in the current month :param period_name: the period for which we want to get information: day, week or month :param period: current day, week or month :param family_id: id current family :return: family members who made purchases in the current month

TelegramBot.db.get_spend(period_name, period, family_id)[source]¶

Searches for information about product categories and prices, purchases in the current period :param period_name: the period for which we want to get information: day, week or month :param period: current day, week or month :param family_id: id current family :return: information about product categories and prices

TelegramBot.db.get_spend_member(period_name, period, member, family_id)[source]¶

Searches for information about product categories and prices, purchases in the current period of a particular user :param period_name: the period for which we want to get information: day, week or month :param period: current day, week or month :param family_id: id current family :return: information about product categories and prices

TelegramBot.db.register(user_name, telegram_id)[source]¶

Function for user registration :param user_name: how the user will be displayed in the application :param telegram_id: telegram id of user

TelegramBot.db.user_has_family(username)[source]¶

Сhecks the user’s family status :param username: name of user :return: -1 :
